title: Liverpool news: Mohamed Salah hopes to be fit to face Manchester United after twisted ankle scare
text:
Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah sustained a twisted ankle in Saturday's late victory over Leicester but has a fortnight to regain his fitness before their next match at Manchester United.

A scan over the weekend revealed the Egyptian, who had already been excused from international duty against Botswana next Monday to ease his workload, had escaped serious injury and the player will continue to receive treatment this week.

However, Liverpool insist it is too early to say whether he will be fit for the trip to Old Trafford on October 20.

Liverpool winger Mohamed Salah twisted his ankle during his side's win against Leicester

Salah was forced off in the 2-1 win over the Foxes after being caught on the left ankle by an ugly-looking lunge from Hamza Choudhury.

The Leicester substitute was then booked for the challenge after racing back to stop a counter-attack.

Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp branded the challenge 'dangerous as hell' and Salah left Anfield on Saturday limping significantly.

The injury occurred as Foxes substitute Hamza Choudhury attempted to make a tackle
